admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia
subsc: Law and justice,Sub-national government administration,Central government administration
trustfund:
TF040455-RUSSIA:  REGIONAL FISCAL REFORM,TF025361-PHRD-SUBNATIONAL FISCAL REFORM
            ADJUSTMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Regional Fiscal Technical Assistance
            Project for the Russian Federation aims to build
            institutional capacity for advancing the reform of
            inter-governmental fiscal relations and improving fiscal
            performance at the sub-national level. There are four
            project components. The first strengthens federal and
            regional fiscal legislation by financing international
            experts and local consultants, equalization transfers for
            the regions, federal regulations that monitor sub-national
            fiscal performance, and analysis of existing legislation on
            sub-national public finance and inter-governmental fiscal
            relations. The second component strengthens federal
            monitoring capacity, specifically providing technical
            assistance to fortify institutional capacity in designing,
            implementation, and monitoring structural reforms and
            performance at the sub-national level. Expenditures include
            computer and information technology, the creation of a
            library and on-line databases, development and dissemination
            of principles of good practice for regional financial
            management, design of financial disclosure requirements,
            ongoing monitoring of fiscal and structural reforms and
            compliance with federal laws and regulations, analytical
            support and policy advice, training, as well as office
            furnishings and administrative and computer support. The
            third component assists sub-national governments in
            accounting and budgeting while the fourth component finances
            sectoral public expenditures reviews.
